Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you need to do it for an assetchain that has a faucet funded

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: like KMDICE

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: #kmdice

Author: ashwin#5867
Content: @jl777c what is an asset chain? And what is a faucet fund. It‚Äôs confusing to me.

Author: Nabob#5004
Content:
@ashwin  
faucetfund amount - donate/send your funds to the faucet
```faucetfund allows anybody to add funds to the faucet
faucetget allows anybody to get 0.1 coins from the faucet as long as they dont violate the rules.
And we come to what it is all about. The rules of the faucet. Initially it was much less strict and that allowed it to be drained slowly, but automatically and it prevented most from being able to use the faucet. ```
Please go through our documentation for Asset chain  and other technical features here
https://komodoplatform.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/KPSD/pages/71729160/What+is+a+Parallel+Chain+Asset+Chain

Author: ashwin#5867
Content: How can I re-build only a particular file when I'm working on it?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: make

Author: ashwin#5867
Content: What are the parameters that needs to added to faucet2?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: would be up to the designer of faucet2, but for starters all the paramaters that need to be tunable

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: amount given, rules about repeated usage

Author: ashwin#5867
Content: How do you get the rpc request parameters on the server side?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it would do the rpc side like reward CC does, using its rpc calls with parameters

Author: ashwin#5867
Content: is there a documentation to this function ? `evhttp_make_request`. I need to understand how this function works.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: look in rpcwallet.cpp there are the functions that process rpc calls

Author: ashwin#5867
Content: Ok. Thanks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it just parses the command line args and calls internal functions to implement the rpc method

Author: ashwin#5867
Content: That's what i was looking for.

Author: ashwin#5867
Content: how long does the command `./assetchains` take to complete?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: depends on your system spec and how many chains you want to run. generally done within 15 minutes max

Author: ashwin#5867
Content: how do i run kmdice as an assetchain?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: `./komodod -ac_name=KMDICE -ac_supply=10500000 -ac_reward=2500000000 -ac_halving=210000 -ac_cc=2 -addressindex=1 -spentindex=1 -addnode=144.76.217.232 &`

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: every chain has their own start command which you always should use to use the same chain. if you change any param, that will be a fork or another chain

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: you can use #kmdice to get more info about that chain

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/komodo/wiki/Detailed-Guide-to-Start-KMDICE-Chain-and-Play-Dice-Using-CLI

Author: ashwin#5867
Content: How to add a contract to the chain?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: you want to code new contract?

Author: ashwin#5867
Content: No use an existing one.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: check the link i posted ^^

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: that explains how to start the chain and play Dice

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
and this
https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/Mastering_CryptoConditions

Author: ashwin#5867
Content: ok. Thanks

Author: ashwin#5867
Content: To test can i use my localhost?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: what do you mean by that? without internet connection?

Author: ashwin#5867
Content: Yes. For the last parameter where it says `addnode=` can i give 127.0.0.1?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: no

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: it has to be an ip of your local network, KMDICE will not work like that. you have to create your own assetchain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the seednode needs to have the KMDICE chain, though for notarized chains, it might pick it up from the DNS seeds

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but if you are not connected to the internet, then you cant sync to a chain that is on the internet

Author: ashwin#5867
Content: ok.

Author: ashwin#5867
Content: where can i get the list of public nodes that are available?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: you can use `getpeerinfo` call

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: the seednode is already on chain param

Content: like it shows in the reference invocation?

Author: ashwin#5867
Content: ok

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Regarding the `./assetchains` to start  assetchains, I have a slight mod to those sctipts that allow you to add the name of the chain you want to start, so it doesnt start them all.

Content: I think it came directly from lukechilds, who wrote all those scripts, it just adds an extra parameter to `listasetchainparams`
